de.susebox.java.lang
Class DefaultEnvironment

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--de.susebox.java.lang.DefaultEnvironment
All Implemented Interfaces:
Environment
public class DefaultEnvironment
extends java.lang.Object
implements Environment

The DefaultEnvironment implements the Environment interface using the JDK class System. Instances of this class are returned by the singleton EnvironmentProvider (EnvironmentProvider.getEnvironment(java.lang.Object)) if there is no other Environment available for the caller.

Author:
Heiko Blau
See Also:
Environment, EnvironmentProvider

exit

public void exit()
          throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
This method exits the instance of its Environment implementation. After calling exit the Environment instance is generally not any longer usable. In particular, an implementation can choose to call System.exit(int).

Specified by:
exit in interface Environment
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the method is not available
See Also:
setExitStatus(int), System.exit(int)
